intro: Alsodeiopsis chippii subsp. villosa, commonly known as the hairy alsodeiopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
